“Damn them!” Raskolnikov shouted. 

“Don’t be downhearted. It’s a shame!” 

He thought, “He really has put it well.” 

“Must I explain myself again?” he asked bitterly. 

Razumihin seized his shoulder. “Stay! You were wrong!” 

“What trap?” Raskolnikov replied, disgusted. 

“The question about the workmen. You could have lied.” 

“If I had done that, I would have claimed to see them.” 

“Why deny it?” Razumihin pressed. 

“Only novices deny everything. Experienced men twist the truth.” 

Raskolnikov felt the weight of his thoughts.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov grapples with the psychological intricacies of his situation and the impending cross-examination regarding the murder.
